motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • January 10, 2022, City Council meeting minutes • Emergency ordinance declaring local emergency of Novel Coronavirus Disease 2021/2022 Omicron Variant Global Pandemic to allow City Council and city boards to conduct public meetings via teleconference

motions.title: Motion to Move Al Fresco Grant Item to Last Discussion Item
motions.description: Motion for agenda item #9 (Al Fresco Grant Request) to be moved to last item under Discussion Items.

motions.title: Motion to Defer RZ 21-02 to February 14 Meeting
motions.description: Motion to defer RZ 21-02 (11 Ravinia Drive rezoning second read) to February 14th meeting. Staff requested deferral.

motions.title: ESRI 3-Year Renewal
motions.description: Approval of ESRI 3-year contract renewal for GIS mapping software in amount not-to-exceed $116,100.

motions.title: FortifyData Renewal
motions.description: Approval of renewal of contract with FortifyData risk management platform in amount of $18,518.52.

motions.title: Request to Sell Surplus Technology to City of Doraville
motions.description: Approval to surplus remaining technology equipment and sell all surplus technology equipment to City of Doraville for total price of $1.

motions.title: Contract Approval for Brook Run Park Lighting Project with Georgia Power
motions.description: Approval of contract for Phase 2 and Phase 3 of Brook Run Park lighting project with Georgia Power with not to exceed cost of $800,000. Expected cost $784,200 funded by CARES II funds.

motions.title: Contract Amendment with Blount Construction for Additional Pavement Marking
motions.description: Approval of contract amendment with Blount Construction increasing contract by $86,156 for total contract price of $3,342,936 for additional pavement marking and raised pavement markers.

motions.title: Motion to Enter Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to enter executive session for the purpose of legal and real estate discussion.

discussionItems.title: Discussion of Vermack Road Shared-Use Path Adjacent to Dunwoody High School
discussionItems.description: Conceptual design for 12' path on Vermack Road between Womack Road and Vanderlyn Drive to replace existing sidewalk and accommodate bicyclists. Cost just under $500,000. Council asked for cost analysis of angled parking with 5' sidewalk. Angled parking could add 12 spaces but would double project cost.

discussionItems.title: Discussion of Replacement of Taser X2's with Purchase of Taser 7's
discussionItems.description: Police department's Taser X2's nearing end of useful life. Replacement with Taser 7's would automatically turn on body cameras and vehicles when pulled from holster. Cost $230,404.73 funded from SPLOST.

discussionItems.title: Discussion of Additional Human Resources Position Funded by CARES II
discussionItems.description: Request to add additional Human Resources position due to unexpected 24/7 increase during COVID. Position proposed for this year and next year, funded by CARES II. Decision on full-time need by summer 2023.

discussionItems.title: Al Fresco Grant Request
discussionItems.description: Request from The Shops of Dunwoody for Al Fresco Grant of $113,336 for furniture and fixtures for outdoor dining space. Council recommended restructuring and formalizing grant program before making awards and advertising availability to all businesses.
